an4.105:4.3: ~One is unripe but seems ripe, ~one is ripe but seems unripe, ~one is unripe and seems unripe, and ~one is ripe and seems ripe.
an4.105:4.5: In the same way, these four people similar to mangoes are found in the world.
an4.105:4.7: ~One is unripe but seems ripe, ~one is ripe but seems unripe, ~one is unripe and seems unripe, and ~one is ripe and seems ripe.
an4.105:5.1: And how is a person unripe but seems ripe?
an4.105:5.2: It’s when a person is impressive when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and aside, when bending and extending the limbs, and when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes.
an4.105:5.3: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an4.105:5.4: That’s how a person is unripe but seems ripe.
an4.105:5.5: That person is like a mango that’s unripe but seems ripe, I say.
an4.105:6.1: And how is a person ripe but seems unripe?
an4.105:6.2: It’s when a person is not impressive …
an4.105:6.3: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.105:7.1: And how is a person unripe but seems ripe?
an4.105:7.2: It’s when a person is not impressive …
an4.105:7.3: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.105:8.1: And how is a person ripe and seems ripe?
an4.105:8.2: It’s when a person is impressive …
an4.105:8.3: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.105:8.7: These four people similar to mangoes are found in the world.”
